content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I'll approve it because it's hard to live with 9x9.
The trick is to make two eyes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting to explore how the same rule can lead to a quite different game with smaller board and branching factor.
why not just updating the already approved version ....?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: With 200 turns and a 9x9 board, this version will require more strategical positional patterns (as "classic" go : zone occupation) than the 19x19 version where there are always locations to play

Hello.
I enjoyed a series of Go programs.
AtariGo is for introductory purposes, so there are some holes in the competitive game.
However, in the case of an actual "go" game, the "seki" judgment is difficult.

I found a "pure go" that can be played with a slight change to Atari Go.

The changes are also easy.
The player with more stones on the board at the end will win. The rest of the rules should be the same.

It's in Japanese.
https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%B4%94%E7%A2%81

Since I was asked to upload a modified version of my Atari Go game with only 9x9 boards in every league ... well here it is :)

It's only a slight modification of the original Atari Go multiplayer game (https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/507644dbe6bc6fc318eeaa25e26e48954355).

Changes (till now):
- This one uses only one board size of 9x9
- The statements are updated to fit to the new rules

If you have any further ideas or feature requests, please let me know :)

This modification of go sounds quite interresting. And it sould be easy enough to calculate the points and the final state during the game.

I'll try to create a game like this as soon as I find the time. :)

The name of the modified game is "Pure Go"?
It was a bit difficult to understand that part using google translate...
The approved version uses 19x19 in the top league. 9x9 Go is probably a very different game tactically.
so ... if we wait enough ... we'll get a 13x13 version ... understood ...

:D
Seriously, I think it's more interesting to have the "extremes", not the middle version.

I feel that the name can be left as it is.　
"純碁" can only be said as "Pure Go" when translated into English.　:)
